intro: Spilanthes heliantiflora, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spilanthes heliantiflora is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
